channel.title: Implementing a Dictionary with an Array-Like Structure :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Implementing a Dictionary with an Array-Like Structure In the previous section, we discussed how linked lists could be used to implement a dictionary. An alternative to a linked list would be an array. A couple of other alternatives are the non-generic System.Collections.ArrayList or the generic System.Collections.Generic.List<T>. These classes are similar to singly-dimensioned arrays, but they can grow as needed. In this respect, they are like a StringBuilder, but instead of storing chars, an ArrayList stores object?
